reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From June 18 to the 25th, my husband and I stayed in Studio #612, right next to the elevator (never waited more than 30 seconds for it to arrive to our floor). Lighthouse Cove resort was fantastic. It's easy to locate, at light at the intersection of 14th St. and A1A, and 1/2 hour from Ft. Lauderdale airport. I walked for miles on the clean sidewalks every a.m., and enjoyed the beautiful scenery. We rented a car from Hertz (they picked us up and dropped us off after turning in the car) and enjoyed the free parking at LHC. We loved the ocean view from our studio, if you go don't forget your binoculars. LHC is beachfront and has a great pool with loads of noodles for those who enjoy floating. There's also a jacuzzi, plenty of loungers and umbrellas, tables and chairs. The beach is beautiful, snorkeling is okay at the jetty. Security is out and about and visible but not intrusive. Our studio was very clean and had an updated kitchen (granite counters, stainless steel appliances) and was the most well equipped kitchen we've ever had in a rental. An in-room safe was also available which was greatly appreciated. We had plenty of towels and there were no problems if more were needed. Food and drinks were reasonable and very good at the Tiki Bar ($2.50 breakfast) and the restaurant. A variety of live music was performed and enjoyed throughout the week. The female lead singer, performing Father's Day, was fantastic! The band played 'baby boomer' music and we loved it! The p.m. band played older music, Frank Sinatra era, and that was enjoyable as well. It's a fun place to people watch.
reviews.title: Great Vacation Place! We loved it!

reviews.text: Last but not least, the Main Desk personnel were courteous, respectful and supplied helpful information to all my questions. I was always greeted with a smile. In the Lobby, there are two computers for guests to use and, what I've never experienced, printers for the guests to use. What a time saver to be able to print my boarding passes right at LHC and not have to go out looking for a computer cafe!! I thought I had died and gone to heaven! Check-in and check-out were a breeze. We had a fabulous vacation and would have no qualms returning.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE

reviews.text: I have been going to lighthouse cove for the past 10 years. and it has made a transformation from a place that is so so, to a wonderful resort that you can enjoy with family and friends. A great place for the price, mangement, location, beach, food, and accomadiations. Yes, you can go to another newer resort and pay a lot more, but you would not have the access to what i call , local fun. You have a beautiful beach a few feet away, the same beach that you would have in another more expensive resort. The same Golf , same everything. The biggest plus, in the mangement, they are helpful, and nice people to have a good time with. The tiki bar is second to none, and if you ask people where they are staying, it would be someother resort, but come there to have fun. So if you are a single person, family, or whatever, you will get the best bang for you buck at this resort. Who ever wrote"dirty door knobs" should know that i have stood in places much more expensive and have had dirty toilets. Go and enjoy. thanks for reading Angelo for R.I.
reviews.title: Comfortable and friendly in a great location

reviews.text: My wife and I have been going to the LHC for almost 20 years together, as her family owns time share there. Each year upgrades are made, but they are limited and sometimes there are annoying issues like broken doorwall latches, etc, that you have to deal with when you first arrive. Mgmt is prompt in fixing those issues when they are reported, and for the most part the rooms are in very good shape. The Florida humidity and salt water take a toll on everything down there, but the place is by no means a wreck. The elevators have their issues sometimes, but they work. Housekeeping is almost non-existent unless you want to pay extra, otherwise they come in and do a full cleaning once a week. However, if the place is a mess I am sure they will send someone up, they are very accommodating. I should note that I have never had an issue with any of this, but I am not the prissy type who needs new sheets every day.
reviews.title: THE BUILDING IS VERY OLD BUT THE RESORT LOCATION AND BEACH ARE GREAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the grounds - this is where the LHC excels. There are four buildings set in a "U" shape facing the ocean. In the middle there is a very large swimming pool that is cleaned meticulously. There is also a large jacuzzi that can fit about 15 people. The tiki bar has decent bar food and cold drinks, and a nice area with umbrella'd tables to sit at, plus a large wrap-around bar. There is a lot of deck space and it is all newer brick paver with nicely maintaing tropical landscaping (palm trees, bushes, etc) throughout. Lounge chairs are everywhere, as well as tables, but you might want to get down there early in the morning to claim your spot as the best spots are taken fast! All of this opens to the beach, which is very nice. You literally walk off the deck and onto the beach. Since this is the Atlantic side, there is sometimes seaweed that washes up overnight, but the beach is cleaned almost daily to remove that stuff. Beach chairs and canopies are available to guests/owners. I think there may be a nominal fee to rent one for the day, but it is not expensive. A small hut near the deck offers sunscreen and other beach items, and rents out waverunners and other fun stuff.
reviews.title: Would definatly go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We rented an unit facing the beach on the first floor, two full bathrooms, a huge bedroom and a nice balcony. There is a Tiki Bar but where was located our unit, we did not hear nothing and it was OK with us. I recommend this place for retired people who likes tranquillity. We are aged 45-50 and we were the youngest couple in the place. Note that we were maybe off-season. The best thing is the beach. You need a car to fully enjoy the place. There is a huge pool. For us, this resort and Pompano Beach are too quiet for us. If we go back in Florida, we will go to Fort Lauderdale, 15 minutes away from this resort.
reviews.title: Much better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been staying at Lighthouse Cove a week or two each year for the past 15 years and keep going back, so there must be a few good reasons for that! Some complain of the noise from the band but I think that it would be very unfair to generalize. It just depends on where your unit is situated. I have never even heard the band or goings on at the tikki bar from the unit where I stayed. The carpet, beds, unit, everything is always very clean. The oceanfront beach view and view of the lighthouse is just out of this world in the unit I stayed in. The staff is very friendly and efficient. Should a problem be encountered they are there promptly to fix it with a smile. For example I didn't like the iron in the unit and was afraid it would stain my clothes so I called the front desk and in a few minutes they were knocking at my door with a brand new iron still in its wrapping. The full kitchen is great if you want to save a little and not have to go out to eat every night. The pool area has been completely redone. You can exchange your dirty linen for clean one as often as you like without a fuss. I guess the only downside I can really think of is an elevator which at times can be very slow!
reviews.title: Life is a beach!
A Trip We Will Remember Forever!!!
reviews.text: All I can say is this is a wonderful resort! We stayed at this place at the end of March 2009, on a Friday to Friday RCI week exchange. My fiancée and I had a two bedroom unit. The unit was very clean and the view from the 5th floor balcony was awesome! I just want to say the staff was great, they were very helpful and friendly. One of the staff members had a sister that lives in our state of GA. The Tiki-Bar and the music were a welcome and a very nice surprise too, but if you didn’t want to hear it all you had to do was close your balcony door. The live entertainment only played until 9:00pm and then the music stopped and lights went out. The ocean and pool view was incredible too…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a little worried because of some of the reviews we had read, but the minute we checked in we knew the negative reviews were unfounded. I noticed that most of the negative reviews came from cheapskates that had booked a studio and then tried the old “let me complain so I can be upgraded to a better unit then what I purchased for free”. Fortunate the great staff at the Light House Cove knows just how to handle these cheapskates:-)
reviews.title: Quality takes time and patience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So all you cheap people leaving this wonderful place bad reviews grow up and check yourselves. My family really loved it! Thanks Lighthouse Cove, we will be back again and again and again:-).
reviews.title: Attended Light House Cove - June 2009

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days in October. As the other reviewers have mentioned, the kitchens have been recently renovated (granite counters/stainless steel kitchens) but the renovations stop there. Outdated and just generally dirty rooms. The room does have decent cable and access to wifi which is a plus. Pool was fine. Tiki bar and food were fine. I think if you know what you are getting (a motel-type atmosphere) and set your expectations low, it is probably fine. If you are used to more modern accommodations this probably will be a big disappointment.
reviews.title: Outdated and dirty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For location, I rate it an A, located right on the beach and nice walk up and down the beach. The beach looked clean-ish, though in the sand remained many pieces of gabage that could be raked up. The pool was ok, lots of older people (age 60+ couples), few young people and/or families. The hotel is VERY dated, few to no real resort amenities.
reviews.title: Great location, crummy resort
dont stay here
reviews.text: The elevator and laundry room were dirty. the activities room looked like something out of a prison movie.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The units were NOT nice at all, and the carpeting had many paint stains (and other stains that were unrecognizable) from a recent paint job. I soon found out that the unit we were in was recently "renovated" Meaning the kitchen was-all new appliances and countertops.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location, walk right onto the beach
I was skeptical based on reviews, but.....
reviews.text: The bathrooms were scary. I had what looked like a 20 year old toilet seat with many nicks and cigarette stains, that I was afraid to sit on! The light covers were coming off of the lights AND I found a worm and ants ---on the 6th Floor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The services we received were great!!! Whenever we needed anything, we got it right away. The view we had was fit for a king!!! We stayed on the 6thy floor overlooking the beautiful ocean & beachand not to mention the pool and suana that was right below us. Every night they had great entertainment from the Tiki bar!!! One more week would have definitely spoiled us!! Cancun used to be our favorite vacation but I think the Lighthouse Point Cove could easily take 1st place!!! We stayed in a Studio unit (a little small) but it was very cozy for 2 people. Perhaps next time we will book a 1 bedroom suite. Wow...can't wait until next year!!!
reviews.title: Simply Beautiful !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at lighthouse cove every year since 2001. Never had a problem with staff or anything. Yes it might get a little loud each nite for a couple of hours, but it is fun having a band outside. NO problems of getting new sheets or towels, you just go down to the laundry room. Or if you need paper towels, soap or toilet paper, not a problem of getting them at the front desk. Our condo, one time had a couple of things that broke while we were there, but maitence came right away. condo has everything, pots pans, dishes, silverware, etc. You can rent a cabbana and lounge chairs on the beach, or umbrellas its a nice place to releax, or you can rent jet skis or boogie board. or just lie in the sun. Yes some of the rooms are outdated. but they have new sliders doors, tvs, couches etc. Dont know what everyone fusses about. dont forget this place was really hard hit by hurricane wilma in october 2005. I was there when it hit. They have fixed it up quite a bit. we are definitly coming down this year. Its not fancy, but we love it there.
reviews.title: love lighthouse cove

reviews.text: Just returned from another week at Lighthouse cove and loved it again. What more could you want a view of the ocean a gorgeous pool and beach. But the best part is the tiki bar with affordable drinks and food and GREAT entertainment every night. We just loved going down and having a drink and listening to the bands. How convenient is that!!! My 3 teens also love it there as there are many kids and lots to do. Wish we owned a week!! Our two bedroom townhouse could use some updating but the view makes up for it.
reviews.title: Our favorite spot in Pompano!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always stayed here for years from the 80's till current,it has turned into a real dump!
reviews.title: A good fire is what this place Needs!!

reviews.text: The management acts like a bunch of crack heads,i have stayed in alot of hotels and this place has become the worst of the worst ,i can't stress enough how poor the management is, and how bad it has become!!!
reviews.title: an OK beach n sand vacation
